p: To determine the causative pathogen, vesicular fluids from varicella and herpes zoster were collected. Herpes simplex virus type 1 (HSV-1), HSV-2 and VZV were detected by nested PCR [ 14], and only VZV was detected (Supplementary Fig. S 2A). The viral load of VZV was assessed using real-time PCR [ 14], and the viral load of VZV in the head (mean of Ct = 17.35) was higher than that in the trunk (mean of Ct = 18.64) (Supplementary Fig. S 2B). To confirm the accuracy of the results, HSV-1, HSV-2, VZV and cytomegalovirus (CMV) were detected again [ 15]. Vesicles in the trunk and head were positive for VZV (Supplementary Fig. S 2C).
